Location
The dryer wasn't working
Location in Airport
The proximity to the airport. I also enjoyed getting a massage in the spa.

I stayed in a room that included hot & cold snacks in the evening. I was so dissapointed with the pre-made platter they gave us. It was a 1/4 cold (I assume it was hot when they made it)  ham&cheese sandwich, a small cup with 2-3 oz of ceviche, and a tiny piece of cake, about one square inch. Not kidding! I should have taken a picture. 
The breakfast they serve for this type of room is also limited.  You're better off renting a regular room and buy your food at the restaurant or at the airport across the bridge, 2 minutes away; lots of choices there.
The swimmingpool is another story. There are no sitting areas to relax. It is not an appealing atmosphere.
Great location right next to the airport! Amazing gym and coffee shop in lobby
We left at 4:00 am

Perfect location without having to leave the airport area. Ideal to stay 1 night if you come from Europe and the next day you connect to another country (transfer)  I loved the Musical Show that they performing in the Bar area! Very good singers!! I liked the variety of food in the breakfast buffet and it's super friendly staff.
It was missing body wash gel and body lotion in the bathroom.
accessibility from airport, design of lobby, helpful staff, easy access to taxis
Location is only good for proximity to airport and sports complex; some amenities were not very useful, for example the restaurant is closed for much of the day
Location, friendly professional staff, comfort
Convenience, cleanliness, pleasant staff.

There were no grab bars in the shower.
The risk of slipping in the shower is high given the lack of these bars.
Further, there were no towel racks in the bathroom.
Walls are not soundproof...I could hear the occupants in the next room, talking, laughing, showering and going to the toilet.
I did not have breakfast.
In the executive room my friend and I stayed, the water we were using while taking a shower got out of the shower area.

I love the bed linens and towels, spacious bathroom.  The breakfast buffet is excellent except they don’t let you serve yourself coffee and the waitress is overwhelmed.  It took over ten minutes while I was seated with my breakfast to get coffee.  That’s pretty annoying when you’re tight on time.

Getting coffee was a major ordeal.  Very slow service.  Please make it self serve like other hotels do.
Too much noise in the dining room.  Different TV stations blaring.
Our room seemed to have a pile of sand by one of the beds—very strange.
There’s live music till 10pm which you can hear in the room.  We tried to go to bed at 9pm, having flown 10 hours. We had to wait till 10.
Very comfortable bedding, the mattress, pillows and sheets. I had an incredible nights rest after long haul flights.

i didn’t like that the bellboy wasn’t around to take my bags to my room. I needed them done upon arrival to be able to sleep as soon as possible. I had to take the bags myself and the hallways had a carpeted floor that make it very difficult for me to drag my bags in.
Awesome!
This is a large room and large bathroom.

Being a Friday night, there was live music in the hotel lobby until 2:30 am. (At least that is the last time I looked at the time.) The music volume should be less for those rooms facing the lobby atrium.
It is super close to the airport, easy to walk there if you have a late or early flight.
Our room felt dirty, you could tell they didn't do a good job sweeping also the duvet was not properly set in one of the beds.
Clean rooms, fast check in
The wifi in the rooms didnt work, only the lobby wifi was working.
Very comfortable beds. Quiet. Great Food in the restaurant. A little pricey but that was ok too
Would have liked Coffee Machine in the room
The comfort of the room.
The distance to walk from and to the airport from the hotel.
Very comfortable for a quick stop of one night and then be ready next day to keep going.

The hotel was conveniently located next to the international airport terminal, with a sky bridge connecting the two buildings. Our stay was very short and the hotel was what we needed, a comfortable place to spend the night. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.
The bed was small and the bathroom door doesn't provide full privacy (i.e., your partner can see and hear what you are doing in the bathroom).
airport proximity
inadequate air conditioning
The friendly staff
Floor was in very bad shape, I almost cut my feet right next to the bed
Hotel not busy at this time and I was upgraded to a better room
Location

We were first assigned a room with an extremely high noise level, apparently from some nearby hotel fan equipment.  After determining it was too loud to ignore, we complained and were immediately moved to another room.  Apparently it was a known problem and we should never have been assigned the room.
perfect location for a layover in MEXICO

Excellent location
Check in and check out were really quick
n/a

It was an easy walk to the hotel from the airport. It felt safe to get directly off the plane and into the hotel.  It was a great transition from my flight to my journey the following day.  I would stay here again.
all was good
building feels old
I had a renovated room this time
The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great. Food at all the restaurants was delicious.
The WiFi was extremely slow and below standard for a hotel of this caliber.
I like everything

This hotel is in an excellent location if you have an early flight departure (or late arrival) from/into Mexico city, as we did. There is a covered walkway directly from the hotel into Terminal 1. The beds are really comfortable and the hotel is quiet (ie you are not aware of vehicle or flight traffic noise) - so perfect for a good nights rest before or after a long flight. If you arrive before check in times there is an option of leaving luggage safely with the concierge.

There are no facilities to make tea/coffee within the room, and although there is a restaurant and Starbucks coffee outlet at the hotel - these are expensive. Fortunately its a short walk to the airport terminal where there is a reasonable range of food and beverage outlets. Quite far from city attractions, so not an ideal position if you are planning this hotel as your base for exploring mexico city.
Very handy to the airport, especially for a layover and some much needed sleep. Very comfortable bed.
Can’t think of anything
STAFF
Shuttle took to long, I had to take a taxi after waiting for 30 minutes.
Great location for a next day flight

Very poor information at the arrival. Since we are 5 we were forced to take 2 rooms. One of them had coffee and a bathrob sandals, the other one was very basic, it included the breakfast only for some.of us, but we were told it included only one breakfast.  So we had to ask again. And we had to pay in cash at the restaurant. For the amount of money that we paid we expected better service,
The room view was excellent.
Clean and spacious room
The shower, when one of my sons took a shower the room got flooded with water. Still don’t know what happened but I’m guessing because of the lack of shower curtain or door.
Location
Hotel rate.  Cost of breakfast buffet.

the hotel is quite old, has gone through several brands over time. rooms are refurbished now and the bathroom is very spacious, comfortable and has all the necessary amenities. there is more than one restaurant to choose from for dinner.

they charged my card and made the mistake to take payment from me a second time at check in. they told me about this mistake soon after check in. however, it has been four weeks almost and i still have not got reimbursed for this. it is so tiring to take the time to call them over and over to see why I have not got my money back yet.
In airport. good restaurant. excellent staff
Slow elevator.

Wonderful staff, comfortable bed and pillows, airport shuttle service. Great location.
Slightly pricey but close to the airport, so expected.
Location, staff and room
In the first room the a/c wasn't working. They put me in another room. Which was nice
Hotel is close to airport and free transfer is every 30 minutes. Personal was very nice. Has hot water. The room was big. AC worked properly and quietly.
The room was not really ready: no bottles of water as it said, only one face towel (had to ask to bring one more), weak wifi in the room and very uncomfortable pillows.

We had a one night layover while flying in / out of Mexico City airport. The huge bonus is that this hotel offers a complementary airport shuttle which we used in both directions. This was incredibly helpful and reduced stress. So for this reason, I would recommend this hotel.
The accommodation is basic. There was very little light in our room - which was fine as we were only there overnight, but I wouldn't stay any longer.
Rooms were large and well furnished. Updated bathroom.  Female desk staff especially helpful.
The hotel is not that close to terminal 2.  We took a taxi rather than figure out the free shuttle.
Updated and clean rooms! Enjoyed my stay.
The a/c was not blowing much of cold air. Felt humid at times.
Amazing shower great staff , 5 minute walk from terminal 1
The room was great. Huge bed. Quiet. Hair dryer and coffee machine. We got a food delivery in.
The bed had some kind of mite and I’m itching like mad since. My ankles are bitten 15+ times. I found no bugs and the bites aren’t like bed bugs
The hotel is nice and the room comfy with working wifi.

The shuttle is the worst bit. You arrive at the meeting point for the 4 p.m, shuttle having been specifically told you DO NOT need to book it as it is is there every 30 minutes, but you wait and wait and wait then try to call the hotel which is difficult as it's mega noisy outside the airport and you can hardly hear the receptionist. After many attempts, you hear her say she will SEND the shuttle. That means they simply don't bother until you ask them to. It's a really nasty start to the stay when you're exhausted after travelling. I only booked this hotel as they allegedly had a shuttle.
Loved the shower.  Huge, great shower head, lots of hot water.  Around the corner from the airport but very quiet.  Good price.

Difficult to locate pickup area for free shuttle to the hotel.  (It’s actually inside the airport.  Would be helpful if that info were posted in the write-up.). Also, I wanted to tip the driver but the front desk could not make change.  Driver had to track down change so I could give him a tip.

The shuttle service is very practical, it is easy to reach the hotel from the airport within a few minutes. Very useful if you have to stay overnight in Mexico before catching a connecting flight the next day.
clean, close to the airport

Very convenient shuttle service for an already convenient location by the airport (<5 minutes). We were very happy to be provided with a bottle of water per person in our room, and the breakfast (chilaquiles in particular) was excellent
The double beds were a rather tight fit for two people
Location and great gym
The hotel offers airport transfers 24 hours a day, at least once every half hour.  It was about 5 minutes to the airport at 3:00 a.m.
convenient for airport
restaurant and social spaces lacked atmosphere
Great place to stay if you need a night near the airport. Clean rooms, comfy beds
Breakfast wasn’t included
Fairly close to the airport and best of all shuttle including. The hotel's restaurant food was great, clean and exceptional service.
Rooms are basic yet comfortable, except that the AC never kicked in.  Something to check beforehand.
Very quiet, very helpful staff.
N/A
close to airport, large room with good shower

the free shuttle apparently does NOT come to Terminal 1 without a phone call. This was not made clear in hotel’s written answer to my query. “free shuttle every half hour”. We waited for over an hour, the had to take a taxi for 180 pesos.
the location is perfect, close to the airport
TV signal weak and not variety of channels
Please thank everyone who went to the trouble to print my boarding pass.
However, the ramps are just a bit too steep for wheelchair users.
Location, shuttle to Terminal 1 and 2, nice big bed, satisfying restaurant and price.
Location relative to the main airport. Free shuttle. Clean, basic room for a reasonable price.
No extras in room like a refrigerator, ice, or microwave. And the pillows were terrible.
The room was well equipped , and a coffee machine was a nice touch. it was very comfortable and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The shuttle service was on time .

The wifi , or lack of it. We were on the third floor and on signing into wifi found it was so weak it kept dropping off completely . I went to the front desk and reported the issue and they said they’d arrange for someone to come and fix it. This meant an outside contractor with arrival time unknown. As we wanted to get some sleep before a 1.45am wake up call I finally cancelled the request . it’s essential for an airport hotel to have functioning reliable wifi.

The location is perfect, really near the airport and the transport leaves every half hour, we were on time for our flight and the late check-in it is really good. The personnel is really friendly and always able to help. The bed is comfy and the room is not noisy at all.
We found a ball of hair in the floor drain of the bathroom what made us wonder if they really desinfect the bathroom. But everything else look really clean
It was an attractive, modern, comfortable, friendly place. There is a restaurant on site. The free shuttle to the airport runs every half hour all night.
The traffic is always very heavy and the shuttle took quite a while so added a lot to the travel time. The pick up place in Terminal One was a very long walk from the arrival area.
Arrived after midnihgt and main door to hotel was closed
we had a layover. came in late and left early so we didn’t get to explore much but it was great for our needs. Clean, close to the airport and easy access back and forth.

Nothing. It was perfect for our needs. Beds were ok. The place was clean and the staff were friendly 
small complaint. the restaurant didn’t open until 7am. I would have liked to have a coffee and a light breakfast before we left.
near airport
none
The shuttle was easy, I just stayed for one night but it was comfortable and felt very safe staying as a single woman
Staff was on point. Made us feel so safe and taken care of. Shuttle is so easy to arrange and worked like a charm
Na
Breakfast was adequate.
The coffee machine in the room was too complicated 😕 to use
For this price a good hotel and close to the airport
All in order very close to the airport and clean, organized and nice staff
the street outside is ugly so going out walking at night doesn’t seem safe but for a night close to the airport is actually perfect
Great location and convenient to airport
Near highway so was a little noisy

I just wish that his place at bat away for handicap people to enter the hotel I just had to back operation and it had stairs going to the elevator and going inside the property. That’s what I did not like getting in.
Was not very good for wheelchair to get access?
Right next to the airport, we walked and it took 5 minutes. Room was fine, nothing special. Very convenient for a layover.

The shuttle bus service wasn't very fast. We waited for the shuttle from the airport for approx 1 hour before we gave up and decided to walk to the hotel as we had a dinner reservation. When we got to the hotel the shuttle hadn't left, even though they said they were in traffic (there wasn't much traffic) when we called.
free shuttle
toilet smells
Good location near the airport.  Staff was friendly.  Room was nice with a great bathroom.
We had to wait 30 Minutes at the airport to be picked up.  The hotel was only a 7 minute drive away from the airport.

the property is located centrally and easy to get around
the rooms are out dates run down and feel like a Holiday Inn.  if you are on the ground floor - they have a terrible mold and mildew problem that needs to be addressed.

Location is excellent. And despite that the hotel was founded more than 30 years ago, it still has all the Camino Real style all over! Love the wide spaces, cosy rooms and the overall amplitude that can be sensed everywhere. Really enjoy my stay.
Nothing. Really liked the facility. Perhaps having a jacuzzi or bathtube instead of the shower would had exceeded all my expectations. Aside from it, remarkable hotel.
the hotel is excellent and a blurry confortable room

only comment is on the last day, they forget to complete the towels, no water
was left and it was like they didn’t finish the room

Very good room. Garden view was just lovely. Birds singing in the morning and very quiet at night.
Ideal location for museums in one of the best neighborhoods.
Breakfast was a great experience. Quality food and variety. Excellent service .

A rather long walk to reach the room. There was no front illumination In the bathroom. Frontal lamps should be added.
And room light switches operation was confusing.
Two different cards to gain access to our room could be corrected.
everything was perfect. highly recommended
n/a

Asked for more hangers; brought quickly. Asked to book tickets: flawless execution by concierge. Friendly service without ever being obsequious or overly solicitous. Great heated swimming pool.  Brilliant architecture; unlike other international hotels this one could only be in Mexico. Perfect location by the park; walking distance to one of the worlds greatest museums in a city that rivals New York, London, and Paris for travelers who love to walk.
Nothing. This is the only hotel we will stay in whenever we return to Mexico City.

Camino Real in Polanco is probably my favorite hotel, worldwide!! Everything in this hotel breaths class and elegance: architecture, design, … The hotel is gigantic, yet still feels cozy and peaceful. Rooms are super with the best beds you can get. Food, be it the breakfast or lunch or dinner in one of the 3 top class restaurants, is outstanding. The garden with pool is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of CDMX. Staff is amazing, always ready to help with a smile. Camino Real in Polanco is the top of the top!!!
There is really nothing I can think of that could be better.

good people, security and reception, wonderful breakfast
bathrooms can be a little more shiny
The location is excellent,  the reception area, the breakfast restaurant,  the gym , the pool ...and above all the team was super helpful all the time!
The room's door needs to be renovated, it was shaky and didn't close well.

The design of the hotel is exceptional… The light changes the look every few hours, and as we were in town to see architectural sites this is very much appreciated! The staff was extremely helpful and the breakfast was fabulous!
Professional and clean, safe area.

It's always great to stay in a historic or architectural landmark. Pretty much everyone knows where it is. Our room was fine, we looked out over the lovely interior garden and the pool. The service was very good in all respects, including the concierge.
While I appreciate the architecture of the CR, The interior needs updating. The public spaces feel too vast and unpopulated, it'd be nice to have some more intimate spaces.
Facilities and rooms were amazing! Restaurant was excellent.

Almost all was good. The only disappointment was that we weren't told ahead of time that the Club Floor was being renovated. They did provide a private restaurant on main floor in place of.  Felt appetizer offerings could have had more options available in the evening.

Only 2 disappointments: we weren't told ahead of time that the Club Floor was being renovated (they did provide a private restaurant on main floor in place of).  2. Felt appetizer offerings could have had more options available in the evening.
crib avilable
Everything else is good.   Location, restaurants, kind and attentive staff.  Very good place to stay.
My last room was way to far away from the main lobby/entrance.  Had to cut across the pool to walk less.  Not a bad negative given that the pool and garden are nice but just a bit of inconvenience
Size of room is excellent
Hotel is nice. However, should consider renewing certain things
todo
Very stylish hotel, breakfast was excellent, room very comfortable and spacious, location was great

Requested late checkout but only given one hour. Asked again later for an extra 30 mins as I had a migraine and was feeling very sick but at the front desk completely refused to help at all. Expected there to be a cafe open all day at a hotel of this sort but they shut early.
wonderful arquitectura! beautiful colours . rooms are big and comfortable. the service is excellent
everything went well.
better room location
Location

Some of staff looked a bit angry according to kids
location and cleanness
dis not have coffee  machine
Great hospitality from every member of their staff. Great food and service in their hotel. Staff members and crew goes above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and safe

Initially was worried. A big conference hotel. However everything worked well, the staff were helpful, room and shower good. Breakfast good and efficient. Quick laundry turnaround. Good coffee shop/meeting place. Everything you need for a business trip.
The location is amazing. Just a few steps away is beautiful Parque Chapultepec, lots of delicious restaurants to choose from and fashinable stores. The rooms anad bathrooms are spacious and clean.

This is an old hotel it could use a little more modernizing. The pool is just OK. I am used to amazing service in Mexico and this time I encountered a few issues at the hotel but all and all it was great. The breakfast buffet is expensive and I wished I could have chosen just a regular breakfast since I am not a big breakfast eater but if you are wow the buffet is off charts!
You did not feel like you were in the middle of Mexico City inside the hotel. Heated outdoor pool was amazing for kids.
One of the rooms on the ground floor had a musty smell.
Great location/ needs to be updated only!
Getting a cab is slow
everything
It would be nice to have an outdoor café for breakfast!!

Excellent hotel, very well located in the heart of Polanco district. The suite was very comfortable, and the hotel staff was super courteous and kind. Water temperature in the pool was excellent, and the breakfast had plenty of options.
Gym is too small for the size of the hotel. Airport shuttle was not available, even though it was offered on the booking details.
The location
It’s fine
Great junior suite. Super choice of restaurants. In a great part of town. Attentive staff. Nice pool in a garden like a little oasis. Well equipped gym.
A little pricey.
They have a breakfast buffet that is delicious! The hotel staff is very friendly and always willing to help and answer guest questions.The rooms are big and very comfortable, very very clean as well.

Amazing breakfast. High hygiene standards. The room was confortable and well insulated.
Nothing.

There's nothing not to like. This is as good as, if not better than Camino Real in La Paz, Bolivia. If you want the best restaurant experience ever, go to Morimoto Japanese Restaurant inside Camino Real. It's the best degustation we've ever had in our lives.
Nothing
The beds were clean and very comfortable. The room was large. They have elegant common areas. The breakfast buffet was good and the location too.
The hotel is very old and the room I had had maintenance issues. The window didn't seal properly and the bathroom door didn't either. It's also a dark hotel, I suppose because its old.
Great location.
A bit noisy in the rooms.
The architecture, the space…
I think the breakfsst should be included in the rate, because it is an expensive hotel..
Clean, close to museum district.

this is my second time staying at this property. I liked the facilities clean, organized and staff are all very friendly from the moment you walk from the elevator.
location in T2 is very handy if you are traveling domestic.
clean and quiet, plus convenient - right in the airport
location very convenient for next day trips. room was clean and comfortable. awesome breakfast!!
a large part of the hotel is under renovation, so expect long walks through dirty alleys, and a bit of noise if you are unlucky with your room location.
Check in process for both of my stays was ridiculously long. The had all of my demographic info, etc., available from my bookings, yet each time I was asked to provide this info in writing.
The room is clean and very comfortable. The breakfast is amazing. The placement of the hotel inside T2 of Mexico City's Airport is very convenient

I was heading for Los Cabos and needed a hotel to spend one night and continue my journey.  Right location for that!
conveniently located

great location,
There was lots of construction going on at time of stay so a little confusing to get around hotel as this was my first time, other than that hotel was great, meal great, very comfortable
Breakfast buffet was not kept very warm
The hotel is essential just outside the airport arrival gates and is perfect if you do not have time to travel to hotels outside the airport.

The room was a bit worn down for the price. There are hotels that are 100 USD cheaper per night in the airport area and nicer. I would only stay here again if I did not have time to get to other hotels.
Great location

Conveniently located, comfortable bed, cozy room
Breakfast not so tasty, treadmill in gym was broken, room was hot but AC was too strong
extremely convenient to T2. nicely furnished room.
guests should know it is being remodeled. there is also loud music from the lounge late into the night. if you have an early flight be sure to ask for a quiet room.

The convenience of the hotel being physically located within the airport footprint was fantastic.   Surprisingly, it was also incredibly quiet with no air traffic noise audible.
The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms well designed.
We also appreciated the opportunity to purchase a delayed check out time to await a later flight time.
The unique circular layout of the main hotel was intriguing.

We found that the hot water was occasionally only luke warm or we had to run the tap for a long time to get hot water.
The sheets in one of our rooms were a little threadbare.
clean and accesible to and from the airport many facilities around and places to eat

made a request of extra pillows to front desk and receive an answer 2 hours later and ive called every 40 min to remind them, then bring the pillows at almost 1 am knocking on the door and calling to the room waking up my kid
Great for spending one night on a layover between flights
Trouble with payment device, took ages to check in because of this. Room is spacious and adequate but can do with a bit of maintenance. Shower head is leaking, Airco sounds like a jet engine..
The coffee machine does not work
The room was clean, location was ideal being within the airport. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We would reserve to stay here again should we return.
easy airport access
it was very expensive
Great room, large, very clean, choice of pillows, great lightning big plasma screen with smart TV, great shower. Loved it. Great breakfast selection. Great reception area as well.
There was no vanity kit, no bathrobe and slippers but I was there only one night and didn't ask, they might have provided it. Some of the personnel at reception struggles a bit with English.

Quite simply the main reason to choose this hotel is for an easy, convenient, and comfortable overnight layover, and this hotel accomplished that.  Room was clean, had thoughtful touches for travelers, and very quiet.
Minor pet peeve for this hotel (and many others) - if you know almost all of your guests are going to be rolling around big luggage, don't use thick pile carpet in your lobby!
Extremely quiet and bed was great.
Very convenient location; 1st class facility & very comfortable room.
The check-in process was very slow.
Renovation very well done
great location in T2 at Madrid Airport
we had an early flight so the location just in the airport was perfect
Specious and clean airport hotel

Check in process took extremely long. None of the staff was competent in English. Apart from being slow in processing our check in, receptionists struggled in their communication with us due to language barrier. After the check out, I've reached out to the hotel twice but they did not respond at all. My family and friends, we've stayed in 4 rooms and after the check out on May 7th till now we've not received the final invoice.
I liked that is the perfect hotel to stay overnight between international flights.
Quality of food in breakfast.

The location in the terminal was perfect for us - overnight layover. It was nicely appointed, very polite and helpful bilingual front desk staff. The room was clean and quiet. 24 hour room service was wonderful and had very good service.
Smell of stale cigarette smoke prevalent in the lobby- likely hard to get rid of and possibly a result of air intake from outside.
Ideal location to rest at the airport after a long flight , very clóse to Arrival Gates at Terminal 2 CDMex B.Juarez airport

Hotel located on Airport T2
big rooms, great breakfast, big bathroom
Not good smell

Great location and safe hotel
Breakfast is weird, more like lunch than proper breakfast items
Everything Except the Beds not comfortable.
Beds were Not comfortable.

The location is very close to the Catheral, the ruins and the main plaza.   The room is not so big but relatively comfortable.  The staff are very friendly.  Very much worth the price.  
We love the breakfast because the menu for the Mexican portion varied daily (we stayed 4 nights).  There is also the usual continental portion daily.  The hotel also offered free water, 24 hour coffee/tea at the reception.  The restaurant at the ground floor offered affordable food.
I recommend Hotel Catedral for those who want an affordable hotel near the historic center.
We were quite happy with our stay.

Location, staff, cleanliness, restaurant. Breakfast probably suited Mexican people better than Australians but that’s fine. We still had a good breakfast. Loved the packed lunch when leaving for the day before breakfast. Just ask night before. Staff helped with choosing my Mexican phone plan and my flight check in. Beds were very comfortable and shower good. Lighting at bed was great. The restaurant was very good and great value. English menu. To reach Zocolo go left out of hotel and left at arcade and you’re at the back of the huge cathedral in Zocolo. We only discovered this on the last day! it was a terrific location for tourists. Could walk to many attractions from hotel. Ubers were great. Convenient and well priced.

Rooms a little dark especially with dark furniture and furnishings. Nearly ready for at least some cosmetic upgrades. Even changing the ‘carpet’ pictures along the hallways would make a big difference.
Great location and super nice staff. Great breakfast too.
The beds were comfortable but, the mattress cover was not breathable.
location was the best thing.
The power went out in our room and it took a while to get it back.
great location, spacious rooms, good overall services
Breakfast was only soso compared to the rest of the experience. The location is very central and touristic...one should be aware of that.

Location: Great. Right in the heart of the city with lots of heritage buildings around. 
Food: Free food was great. This includes the breakfast and the snacks in the reception. More on that below.
Breakfast: Amazing!! I have never seen these much options for an all-you-can-eat breakfast. There were traditional Mexican dishes and standard US fare. 
Drinking Water: Great. This hotel provides free mineral water. 
Checkout time: 1:30 pm which is extremely helpful - you don't have to get ready to leave right after waking up in the morning. 
Room: Standard higher-end room with a balcony. 
Hotel Common Areas: Clean and beautiful. I especially liked the well-lit stairs area on every floor. 
Staff: Courteous and really helpful. Like drop-what-they-are-doing-to-help-customers helpful. 
The spirit of hospitality has left Canada ( I live in Canada) since the pandemic. However, it is alive and well in Mexico City and especially in Hotel Catedral.

The dinner (Enchilladas) wasn't good - the food wasn't fresh and didn't taste well. I also got a bit of a stomach bug after eating there. I regret getting dinner in the hotel restaurant. However, the staff were really courteous and helpful.  
Pretty much everything else was gloriously awesome though.

I think there breakfast buffet was excellent and I would highly recomend it. Thelma the chef was great and the service was excellent. We had a different dish every day and evrything we had was superb.
At early morning there is no one speak english at the reception
everything: perfect location, beautiful terrace with a view, nice coffee the whole day, fruits and biscuits as a gift, kids friendly
Location was terrific if you jusr want to do the city ad have a comfortable, clean place to rest-up . Breakfast in the morning was also excellent.
Walls a little thin. We heard the guests next to us.
The Staff was excellent and very attentive.  Location was perfect too.
Very central and quiet (!) location, excellent service, very rich breakfast.  Just perfect
The buffet was awesome, attention was perfect too👍 everything was just perfect 👍🥰
great location affordable nice staff
My favorite hotel. Everything is excellent. A very professional establishment.
There's nothing about this place I don't like.

It was my second stay at this hotel. I like the location as it’s very close to the Zocalo and the historic centre.  Buffet breakfast was included in the price I paid.  My room was very comfortable and I shall be returning again in August.
All the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful.
I was happy with everything about my stay.
Breakfast, little snacks
All was great!

The included breakfast was an excellent buffet that changed every day and included some made-to-order options, fresh fruit and juices, many hot items, yogurt, pastries, etc. The rooms were modern and clean. Staff was very kind. The rooftop patio provided perfect sunrise viewing and just the right amount of space for our group to gather each morning. Location is a 3 minute walk to Templo Mayor, the cathedral, and excellent rooftop bars. The lobby was always stocked with free cold bottled water and snacks for guests at all hours.

Not all staff speaks English, so it his helpful to know some Spanish or use Google Translate. 
There was a bit of construction being done next door, so my first floor room was noisy during the day, but you couldn't hear the noise from the other floors/rooms.
Good location, very clean room and bathroom, nice balcony in room, free water in reception was very handy.
nice clean
loved the location and the people that worked there. super helpful. And all the extras like; snacks, water & coffee were all a fantastic touch!
nothing
Well appointed contemporary interior
No way to cool the room at night

Since the safebox was not working, I placed my bag with my documents in a hidden place. However, when I checked out, I forgot my documents, left the city, and remembered until the next day. I called the hotel, and they located my documents (passport and money). The staff went the extra mile to find them. I am so glad that the Catedral Hotel has this quality of staff. 
The fresh guavas in the lobby are nice.
The safebox to place valuables was not working. I did not contact the hotel for them to fix it.

Excellent and friendly staff. Great breakfast and as the area was quiet at night,the restaurant was a welcome place to have an evening meal or snack and drink. The location was perfect for exploring the historic sites. Coffee, water and biscuits were always available free of charge at the lobby.
More could be done with the terrace which offer nice views of the cathedral and old town but there were no bar services so we took our own drinks. A gym facility would be a real bonus
Excellent location in historic center but on a quiet street, comfortable room.
location.
noise.
All the staff were so helpful. Nice to have coffees and teas free during certain times of the day. The terrace was a nice place to sit in the evenings with a view over the city.
Like all hotels people walk about bedrooms with street shoes on: so when bedroom carpets have to be replaced in future maybe free recyclable slippers could be provided by entrance doorway.

I enjoyed so much my stay in this amazing hotel. I loved everything about it. Its location is wonderful, the hotel is located in the heart of Mexico City, very close to the main attractions, public transport stations, shops and restaurants.
The room was very clean, well-equipped. The bed was nice and comfortable.
The best thing about this hotel is the staff, though. They were super nice, kind and helpful. The most important thing that happened to me is that my flight to Mexico City was early in the morning, I didn’t sleep all night and was super-tired. Although the check-in time was 15:00, the staff member checked me in at 10:00. This was so kind of her and I am very thankful to her for saving a whole day of my short trip.
When traveling to Mexico City again, I will choose this amazing and cool hotel again without any doubt.
The only thing I can mention is that I wish there was a fridge in the room so you can put your beverages and food in it))
The breakfast was phenomenal and restaurant was very good. Staff was very polite.
A refrigerator in the rooms would be helpful.
staff very attentive and polite
entrance doors are not insulated and little bit noisy
Great air conditioning. Great location. Staff super helpful and friendly. Good restaurant and room service too!
The staff was very attentive. We very much appreciated the free water bottles in the lobby. There was no limit of how many you could take/day. We loved the extra orders beside the breakfast buffet.
convenient and good value. the restaurant had good variety and cheap!
Everything
Nothing
Everything
The elevator doesn't require the room key to operate. Made me a little bit worry about the safety.

Big spacious rooms, well distributed and clean. Great location and super professional and attentive staff. Everything is taken care of; and they help a lot at the front desk if you need help with anything. I really felt taken care of.
Great isolation with the exterior. (Not so much with the interior corridors - but it is okay if you are not on the lower floors or on the top 7th floor.)

The 7th floor, although nice because it has a terrace, can be a bit noisy in the corridors precisely because a lot of people go up to the terrace. I spent the last night at the 6th floor and it was much better - no noise at all.
Locations was amazing. Breakfast was 10/10. Customer service from staff members was above and beyond.
Whatever you’re doing is working. Employees look happy and their customer service shows it. Keep making your employees happy and in return they make guest happy.
I love the rooms and the staff
Not applicable

location and friendly staff.

small beds. Bathroom/shower  set up was not the ideal for our family.
But, it was good for the price.
The bar was great
The noise!!!! Construcción next door
The breakfast was great and was very quick and in a beautiful setting.
Can't think of anything right now

great location
the concierge service is really helpful
free breakfast was great. There’s a hot Mexican style breakfast (eg eggs, frijoles, salsa, tortilla) then fruit, granola and cereal
as the building is old and built in a courtyard style, it’s quite cold when you go down for breakfast or sit in the lobby but in the summers months it’s probably a blessing
beds are so comfy. the best location!
you can hear everything in main area. very noisy
location and proximity to landmarks and hotspots
too noisy.
Location is great and convenient, staff is friendly and helpful, price is very attractive for the location
Rooms are very small - but aligned with the cost of the hotel night. Maintenance services were not great when I requested support for an issue in my room.
Big and confortable room and bathroom, great staff, very good breakfast.

There was no heater at the room but an extra blanket helped. 
The glass for the shower was too narrow so the water would go all over the place.
Great location, nice breakfast and clean and modern room and bathroom.
Friendly staff, good breakfast included. Location is convenient. We requested to move to a room with airconditioning and they obliged.
great location, staff were excellent, full time doorman
mold in the bathroom
The location and the cleaning as well as the size of the room. The staff were friendly.
The breakfast was very mediocre and the room smelled like cigarettes. Also there is little noise protection and you hear EVERYTHING.
The location was great and Sandy was awesome at the little restaurant in the hotel.
The beds were not comfortable and no AC.
Great location, good breakfast
hard bed, hot water didnt work
The hotel was so charming! Breakfast was delicious, although a little more food variation wouldn't have been bad. Staff was kind and helpful.
I didn't love the tile floor in the bedrooms. My husband did though, so I guess that's personal preference.
Great location
Nothing to complain. No breakfast, though it was promised.
Location
Glass door for toilet and shower
Central location in Condesa. Plenty of places to walk to. The hotel staff was nice.

The walls were paper thin. I could hear the person in the room next to me do just about anything. I had a hard time falling asleep on the first night because people were being loud downstairs and then I was woken at 5:30 AM by people talking very loudly in the lobby for an hour. My room was on the street so the cars were super loud as well.
The price and the location, also the common areas are nice, and the staff it's very kind.

Spiderman come to my room.
I found a 🕷️ on the ceiling, and the sheets haves something makes me scratch also the noise because even they give an upgrade, and I appreciate that, my room was 110 on the ground floor besides the restaurant and they put an small curtain when I wake up two guys seating right on my window were looking at me, that's was weird and uncomfortable.
Good location to coffee shops & restaurants & a 1/2 walk to Chapultepec Park.  About an hour walk from Mexico City Zocalo area to Hotel.

The breakfast was not a very big selection & it was the same thing for 4 days.  No variety from the selections.  breakfast in my opinion was not very good.  Beans were not hot.  Coffee was AWFUL & not hot.  I knew the building was old & an open lobby area allowing heat or cold to come in.  Was there in Dec, so pretty chilly.  I read reviews before booking there on echoing from the lobby area.  I did not find this an issue when there.  We had a heater in our room to keep warm.  No blow dryer provided so bring your own.  Bed was SUPER COMFY.  I wish they offered you an option to the eating area for hot water & tea throughout the day, but they did not.  At least with my experience. They closed off the area.  Staff was super accommodating to giving us a king size room near the back where it was quieter upon arrival per my message when I booked the room.
Great location. My room was also specious and I in general loved the vibe of the whole hotel.
The rooms could be a bit cleaner. I had a feeling the floor in my room was not wiped.
The location is perfect, safe and the interior patio is very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful in case you need something.

Rooms have no windows, just a small one that is not enough to get light and fresh air. Because of a nearby construction, it might get loud if you have a room on the construction side, bu that's not fault of the hotel.

Helpful staff.
Good location
Breakfast was ok but not in best location if you go out walking or for dinner in the evening.. not many restaurants.

It was cold in the dining area..maybe some cushions/blankets on chairs. 
At night and early morning staff woke us by talking so loudly..echoes in courtyard.
great location, friendly and helpful staff. the included breakfast was fine. nice hot shower and comfortable bed

if you stay here, inquire about getting a room that is quiet and has good ventilation. we were lucky to get an upper room at the back with two exterior windows - probably as good as it gets here. still pretty noisy (bit it IS Mexico) - some rooms are situated where the noise would have been much worse.

Location is really good, tho it is more Roma Norte than Condesa. Venue is great venue and staff was really really nice. We stayed for two nights and the room was perfect for it. If you stay longer maybe you want a room a little bigger.
Location is vary good
Room is small

Staff friendly and attentive. Lock was broken on our window and they immediately moved us to a different room. Very helpful. When they were unable to give us breakfast, they helped advise on where to go. Comfortable room, good neighbourhood and good place to stay for the price.

Said breakfast was included but then we’re not able to provide it on the day so had to go elsewhere. We were not sure why it wasn’t possible for this to be provided but they were very apologetic (so maybe the chef was ill?), lock on our window was broken but they moved us to another room.
It’s location is perfect !
The breakfast could be better !
Very small
Great location, very friendly staff, complimentary water
Only a fan in the room which was very loud, so either slept very hot or with a really loud noise. Hot water did not work late one night. Otherwise no issues
take the 209 room. that’s basically the only room with windows
just don’t have breakfast here. I wouldn’t even call it as breakfast.
Loved the courtyard and the very kind people there. Great spot to explore the area.
The rooms are really small.
location in condesa was perfect!
hoy water in the room was not available early in the morning
The decor very nice, the lights murals and trees. The room (310) quite specious, fantastic big, comfy and clean bed. Super smily, friendly and willing to help staff!

Sometimes we could smell the drains however if you close the toilet and the window, turn air-condition is OK (super friendly cleaner advised I believe Juan)
The other think the window in the room was dirty, I believe that can be improved easily as well as the window curtain, very thick and tight to the point that I was tying some strings around it to get some daylight.
Great included breakfast, very central location in a very nice part of the city.

-All of the staff was very helpful and friendly.
-The location was very good
-The room facilities en cleanliness of all the Hotel.

-Pillows can be kinda flat 
-Limited buffet options
Perfect Location. Beautiful renovation of an old building.
Small rooms. No windows.
I liked the location in the heart of condesa, close to nice restaurants. Good value for money with the discounted price. The staff was nice and kind, available to meet your needs
The room was very small, way smaller than what I expected. Very noisy, you could hear the cars from the street and your neighbours. The toilet was with glass door and a meter away from the bed.

The breakfast was great - all I have to say is verde sauce w/ chilaquiles. *chefs kiss*
Staff was also nice enough to carry my bags upon arrival to my room and consistently asked if I needed assistance booking a ride.
The room was a little smaller than expected and with no A/C, it would have been nice to have a fan to click on if you are getting warm. Otherwise, it. was a cozy place to lay your head.

Very friendly stuff
Central position 
Huge rooms

The facilities are thought through

The road of the hotel is a bit shady
The room is extremely dark
The acoustics of the building were such that you'd hear every noise in the building
its very clean and has a good location. provides comfort. they had different options for breakfast and the staff was very nice and helpful
there’s no air conditioning, they provide a fan but the rooms feel humid cause the windows are very small and there’s no fresh air circulating
nice property, great staff
air was stagnant in room but staff brought us a fan
Breakfast was amazing. The location more than grate, the service is awesome.

I would only add that the tv signal wasn't that good, even though it had a lot of local channels, but the signal wasn't good, it look blurry or hairlines, not HD or image clear. Also the water didn't was hot my last night, I reported it to reception and they went really fast to solve it.
very unique layout and design
front desk staff could’ve been more friendly

Staff was very nice, breakfast was great, the private pool was exquisite, room size was perfect. Location in the center, very close to Zocalo square. I for sure recommend the 5th floor rooms with a private pool and private sundeck.

Shower is impossible to regulate, either no hot water or only hot water. This should definitely improve in a 5* hotel! Water in the private pool was too hot first day, was okay the next days. Anyway no need to make this water so hot, it is a pool.
I strongly recommend the hotel to place a topper standard on all beds as matrasses are uncomfortably firm. It was like sleeping on a rock or wooden board. I spend over 100 nights per year in hotels so I know what I am talking about.
Clean and decent facilities
Good location. Room was very spacious. Great breakfast.
Lack of window. There was a window is the room but was looking out at a tiny, dark and noise courtyard with pipes. There was no day light in the room.
Location, cleanliness
The breakfast and rooms with no A/C

The room was so nice and clean and set the mood for a wonderful vacation. My husband and I enjoyed looking around the hotel during the day and actually enjoy the hotel room WITHOUT AC which is shock for him.
The bed was extremely HARD so it made sleeping on your side a no go. It felt as if you was sleeping on the floor, which can be good for your back. However, it was much harder than a normal firm bed.
I liked the private pool

we were meant to have early check in and the request wasn’t made as per messages I had. so we had to book another hotel for the morning and the day which cost us more money. the man at front showed me the messages they had but it wasn’t all of the messages which was very disappointing start of our trip. I showed him the messages in my email and still nothing could be done even though someone had checked out of a room as we were there.
there is no air conditioning which I didn’t realise so room quite hot. the man at reception did give us a fan but was still quite hot.
lastly, the hot/cold water kept changing from
boiling to freezing!

Excellent location, 10-15 mins from el Zocalo and 5 mins to Metro. Comfortable room with large bed and free from traffic and street noise. Friendly, helpful staff, with particular mention of the guys in the Cafe and upstairs Bar.

Biggest problem was guests banging doors and other corridor noise. No external windows. Breakfast reasonable but very limited and repetitive. Although there were paying options, I would have expected more choice from a so-called 'boutique' hotel

I think the facilities were pretty nice, the check in was fast and easy. 
All the employees were friendly and helpful, even including the door man! 
I felt really safe in the hotel which is a huge plus.

Showering was a mission impossible. You just simply can’t regulate the water temperature, and this doesn’t mean that I didn’t find the perfect temperature to my liking, no.. The water was either burning hot or ice cold. 
I am not exaggerating.
If you check the other reviews you can see that this is a problem that almost every guest has mentioned, please do something about the shower situation. Also the bathroom sink is hard to use because of the faucet that’s installed so low that you can barely fit your hands under it.
There is not much fresh air in the room, a fan would have been a big help. It’s not that it gets too hot, it’s just that there’s not much air.
I love firm and hard beds but this one was too much. You can feel the springs on your back and the mattress is making a lot of noise when switching sides.
I am not a light sleeper at all but I woke up a few times because of other guests banging doors etc. You can basically hear everything from the hallway.
Last thing, I was really disappointed with the breakfast that was included in our stay. I didn’t expect anything spectacular but this was below average. The coffee tasted like watery tea, the orange juice was horribly artificial and the “fruit plate” (it was just watermelon and a tiny strawberry on top) was soaked in yogurt and honey. 
If you have any food allergies there’s not much you can eat here.
location and adjoining restaurant also great location
view from rooms were not too good and the plumbing (taps) basic
The staff was great, especially Pepe in the restaurant/bar area!
I knew there was no AC, but the fan helped! However, the hot water in the bathroom is hard to control. Lastly, walking through the hallways you can see into some rooms if the windows are open.
safe

no ac, a lot mosquitos, was either being bitten by mosquitos or suffocated of heat
water temperature could not be constants stabilized in the shower

The hotel is very new, staff very kind and good breakfast.
Good internet connection
The room is very dark since there are no windows inside. When taking a shower the bathroom is flooded.
the staff was very nice and sevicefull
there was no A/C
Cool hotel in a nice location
Hot water in shower seemed temperamental and room had a lack of natural light
Lovelu breakfast and great staff, walking distance to centro historico
no HVAC in Room
The room was nice and clean the shower was cool. The staff were friendly and attentive.
There was no air conditioner in the room or a fan so it would get hot and stuffy. It was not comfortable. You can open the windows in there but in the summertime I imagine it gets very hot
friend staff, clear property, and central to everything.
The roof top bard was closed during our entire stay ☹️

Friendly helpful staff 
Central location 
taxi service provided by hotel
Soundproof room no traffic noise
Best shower ever !

Lovely styled boutique hotel. Very clean. Kind & helpfull staff. Felt very safe with security all day/night. Breakfast modest but nice. We also used the restaurant and it has a modest but nice menu. On every floor there is an extra area with chill seatings and couches. Perfect stay, value for money.
The only negative thing I could say is that the rooms are very warm and no Airconditioning. Beds with very hard matrassses. Its not the nicest -fun neighbourhood.
Excellent location walking distance to city center.  Restaurant employees were great!
Dirty fan.  May need A/C in the summer.
everything is really modern and you can see the effort put to have something clean and friendly

The bed was too hard to sleep on. Also the hotel is super noisy. We were constantly awakened by the slamming of the doors in the night. we had other noise coming from the facilities all night long. We were not able to enjoy our nights unfortunately
Very nice hotel everything is new ..great staff
Mattress were very hard but management tried to helps out with giving us 8 pillows.
The restaurants had great food and drinks plus wonderful staff.
The room was warm to hot most of the time. we had the jacuzzi suite and had to leave the door to the upstairs open at night because of the lack of cool air coming into the room.
staff friendliness

Very modern look and staff in restaurant were very nice
Beds were very very hard. Tap didn’t work in bathroom sink and quite a few mosquitos
Everthing was great. We liked how the hotel was designed. The location was was within 20 minutes of the Zocalo.
Considering how warm Mexico is, this hotel could use a good airconditioning or a fan at the least.
Breakfast was good location is excellent
It was a bit hot and sticky at night. A ceiling fan would have been great.
very modern nice looking rooms

no air conditioning and the windows all opened from the inside out into a shared maintenance center where all other guests are able to see into each others rooms  . normally I would just close the windows but there is no air conditioner or fans
The location, staff and breakfast were great.

mattress is too firm. Also, there was no AC in the bedroom

super cool style with the artwork.  modern design in the rooms.  great cafe and bar on site

Location is good, the renovation of the apartments are contemporary which I love, the staff was amazing and kind, the apartments are super clean and for me that's the most important thing. The process to check in & out
was fast and efficient. When I come back I will stay there, it is a no brainer

There were just 2 down points in this property. One is that the beds are noisy, if you have light sleeping that's going to be a problem. And the second one is that they have a building next door that allows parties for young people who put on the music during the weekend like they are in a venue. I was traveling with my little daughter and we were unable to sleep until 2 pm on Saturday, there is no way to stop that according to the staff because every building has its own rules.

Is a beautiful apartment , the location is the best

Beautiful and beautifully maintained property. Excellent location, quiet and adequate pricing.

While the kitchen is fully stocked, it would be nice to have more coffee pods available for the Nespresso machine or at least coffee filters for the drip coffee maker. Nespresso pods are not easily available and if the property is not willing to give them out for free, at least have them available for purchase.
There's nothing not to like.  Huge, beautiful apartment with great service along the way.  Location is very central to most things in Polanco.
I can't remember if you have to pay for breakfast, but don't.  It's not worth paying for.

The location is great, walking distance from many bars and restaurants. The neighbourhood is nice and safe. The room was way bigger than expected and had all the necessary ammenities. Personnel very helpful.
The gym is in the basement and very small.
safe location , very clean and accommodating. staff very helpful
amazingly chic and comfortable

Very comfortable room/apartment.  Excellent location for food and proximity to museums and parks.  Security staff was always there at the front door.  Check in process was easy and as advertised as I was greeted by name when we arrived.
The apartment key reader always took several tries in order to get the door open.  I had to ask for the key cards to be reprogrammed twice.
A spacious suite of two rooms and a very large living room/dining/kitchen that were all very clean and modern.  Nice location in the Polanco neighborhood.  Felt like a home away from home.
Location was great. Walmart very close by and nice restaurants too

The booking process was not transparent. We booked a junior suite and asked for an outside looking suite in upper flowers. we were given a suite facing an inside patio on the first floor. We stopped again and booking offered an upgrade. It was also exterior on the first floor which resulted in a much noisier room.  we were not told by staff upon checking that there were laundry facilities in the basement. we were a party of 5 and the sofa bed was not made and all the dishes and silverware were for 4 people
location is great

great location and spacious rooms
you don’t get a feeling of a 5star hotel, the attention to details is missing and very very poor breakfast
location is the best !
Breakfast was light and great. Location was amazing

Fantastic location and superb rooms with everything you need
everything clean
The property is very comfortable and clean with a fantastic location.
The only drawback of the property was that we didn’t have enough paper replenishment such as paper towels and toilet paper for a family. This was a very small issue for us though.
loved the location, security staff, the size and decor of the apartment and overall cleanliness.

Great location, very clean, feel of "new", cleaning of the apartment each day.
beautiful facilities and great staff
Nice place, location and staff. Would choose for next trip.

Very nice, large and well maintainted appartement with small breakfast buffet (Monday - Saturday). Pleasant neighborhood with restaurants and markets near by. Easy accessible location to discover the entire city by foot or by taxi/Uber.

Rooms are nice and clean. Beautiful roof terrace. Quiet rooms.

Staff speaks very little English, it was hard to communicate.
Food was average. Pillows were not great.
very nice hotel, very comfy
location was not the best.
Big spaces and very clean
a bit far from the city Center
Breakfast is delicious, perfect location, exceptional staff and great rooms and rooms service
new and very spacious room (suit). new facilities.
though staff is friendly, not very flexible on requests: for instance they could not take postcards to send which I have never seen in any hotel.
Food, staff, roof view.
Problem with sound isolation in my first room.
The hotel is new and clean, and very big comfortable rooms! The pools on the rooftop are also great, with an amazing view of the city!

The system of starting a 'tab' while you are there is very confusing and unnecesary! Even though I had a tab everyone still wanted me to just pay my bill directly after ordering anything. This made no sense, and having a hold on that much money was stressful and not helpful!

The breakfast was very good in a lovely setting. However, they can expand and offer a wider variety. The staff was awesome! I loved how spacious the room was. The layout of the room and ultra modern features and everything with sensor .touch. Great View. My favorite was the rooftop pool  360 view of Mexico City and the jacuzzi and restaurant. What a view honestly. Lovely weather. The reception staff was great too, Antonio two other gentlemen I can not recall names but fast and efficient as soon as you call the concierge that is quite amicable in helping you have the best stay possible. Also nearby within walking distance Starbucks, le Pain Quotidien, Globo bakery and a pharmacy.

I was very pleased. Very modern and spacious rooms, great view.  Everything with sensors super modern. My only caveat was the extra security, you couldn't visit one floor just your floor and the shared amenities. since we were a group many of us were on different floors, but I understand.  The entrance for the ubers/taxi to the hotel is not the most accessible a bit weird in design. Overall a 5 star stay and 5 stars for the staff.
The room was great. Large and clean with a mini automatic espresso machine! Awesome shower too.
The location was not good for the activities and areas I visited while being in Mexico City. It took over an hour in an Uber to get to the historical center.
Nice building and their roof pool and restaurant was the best part of all.
after room service you could still see a little dust and hair in corners and I don’t really like dark colors bathrooms because I feel like it hides dirty spots but in general it’s great.

The rooms, food and location are awesome

Everything! The hotel has beautiful views of the greener side of Mexico city. It is super close to Six Flags and the beautiful town of Coyoacán where Frida Kahlos home is. It's also minutes from the famous ARTZ mall which is easily the fanciest mall I have ever seen in the Western Hemisphere! We stayed on the fifth floor and had access to daily snacks and canapes so that we could enjoy food for free daily. The breakfast buffets were divine and the Italian coffee capsules are memorable!!!!
San Jerónimo is 20-22min in an Uber away from the downtown so the distance was the only thing but with ubers we managed to move around with ease alllll over Mexico City for not such a high cost.

Clean. Very good pool on the roof!

the internet in our room didn’t work, and also the tv wasn’t smart.
Beautiful rooftop deck, pool and jacuzzi. rooms were clean and the breakfast was very good. The staff were understanding and accommodated our needs.

the pool is not heated and due to the elevation the pool is very cold.
Location is unusual, not really near too much but would be great for business conferences etc.

Pillows, to fat, had to request a different one, and they had it!
The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The view from our room was amazing as we could see a giant flag of Mexico 🇲🇽

This hotel is very nice, closed to restaurants, shops the rooms are clean, nice you can have a great night sleep is quiet the view on the top is the best but most of all the people that work there they are very, very nice!
The hotel has a great location and amenities. The stuff was very nice and caring. The breakfast buffet was delicious. We used the rooftop pool and gym and were very satisfied.
The cleaning service in the rooms sometimes came very late in the afternoon, so we had to skip it a few days, but apart from that all good.

The 3 rooftop jacuzzis and the beautiful view and the heated pool were my favorite amenities!
I had to pay extra for the breakfast, although it was very good.
It was very elegant and located close to super market and restaurants, but still isolated from all the traffic, also the free breakfast is top notch.

Service is amazing, great and friendly staff especially the concierge, they will help you with most enquiries. excellent.

I had a nicer room to start but it was very noisy next to the stairs. They kindly changed my room quickly after the first night but still woken up on some nights by noisy guests at the main entrance/ reception. 
so unfortunately, I’d say not of light sleepers.
also most windows are facing the inner courtyard which is also the corridor so little natural light.

Stayed here twice during a 3 week trip to Mexico. Very stylish hotel in a good neighborhood for restaurants and bars. It's located in the quieter side of Juarez so you avoid a lot of the Zona Rosa noise. You can easily walk to Roma and Condesa or reach the historical center in a couple of metro stops. Staff were friendly. I've stayed at many hotels in CDMX over the years and this is probably the best.
Some rooms don't have a lot of natural light.

charming place, with a great vibe and decoration.  
the staff is amazing and went above and beyond for us. Best experience in Mexico City so far !
The room was spacious with a fantastic bathroom.
Could have done with a shower cap!
Great location. Juarez is up and coming with walkable cafes and restaurants.

We got master room, close to the entrance. Super clean room, location is great, the hotel is small but very cute. The rooftop restaurant is pricey but have great food, you pay for what you get. All the bath set are good quality, including toothpaste. Safe area and staff are nice. Highly recommended.
Far from the ruins side. A lot of mosquitos (but everywhere in Mexico, not just this place, so get a spray in the convenience store is important)
The staff went over and above helping arrange transfers, writing a kind note to wish my daughter a Happy Birthday and just overall service level was excellent!
modern, clean, very comfortable
location
Hotel is very unique and we loved it
Our room didn’t have a window

We had a special request for our room and the staff did a wonderful job. The area felt very safe and had nice restaurants in walking distance. The room was quiet, beautiful and nicely designed. Staff was very attentive.

There was no safe in the room because it was broken, however the staff offered another one outside our room. Housekeeping was a little bit inconsistent (e.g., occasionally forgot to replace towels). The room was a bit small and had only low natural light.
Perfect location, wonderful staff and service!
Café downstairs would have been great but it did not offer many items and was closed most of the time I was there.

The property is conveniently located near many major attractions. The staff at the hotel go above and beyond with their customer service. They will do any requests that you ask for. The rooms are cozy and comfortable and very clean.

The rooftop restaurant does not offer authentic Mexican food and their menu can be a bit confusing and pricey. Housekeeping needs to be requested daily if you want your room done. These two things were the only flaw but their attention to detail makes up for this in my opinion.
The location was great, many great places to shop and eat. The cafe and the restaurant attached to the hotel were also amazing!

I didn’t like that my room was on the first floor with on the street, as a lone woman traveler it was a bit concerning plus you can hear everything going on in the lobby (earplugs fixed that problem!)

loved the decor, bed was super comfy, A/C was easy to adjust, everyone working at the hotel was helpful and kind. I loved the vibe of the neighborhood. the restaurant was a rooftop bar with delicious breakfast
very clean and close to everything in Mexico City

our stay here was amazing!! We had a large group of people occupying several rooms for a friend's wedding and we were accommodated in so many fantastic ways. Although everyone of the staff members were great, Robert stood out the most ! He was friendly, patient, and let us know all the cool spots we should visit while we were in town. He is the epitome of what great service looks like ! So grateful for him and the rest of the staff.
The room is small and there is no window towards the outside of the building. There is no desk in the room either.
it’s in a great location and has a cool entrance since you can see the elevator. Trendy interior design as well.
The gym consists of two cardio machines placed in full view of anyone leaving the hotel or in the elevator, which for me probably would mean I’d never consider using it.
staff are very friendly and helpful
The building is very beautiful, as were the rooms and the bathrooms were very spacious. As always the staff was beyond friendly and always willing to help.

I did wish our room had had an outdoor window or balcony but at least we were able to sleep deeply. Also, as a female I did wish our bathroom had better lighting for doing my makeup, since I was lacking natural light.

The room was a Master Suite with huge bathroom including a bathtub and shower. We were located on the first floor in the front of the building but we slept well even though we heard some cars on the street. It's an urban area, after all, so it wasn't unexpected. The wood doors sheltered us from light, so we could sleep in. the bed was super comfortable with tons of nice pillows. The staff, especially Alexa, was amazing and super helpful and welcoming.

In our Master Room, we could have used a set of drawers or shelves. the cabinet only had the bottom shelf and about 10 hangers. we used our suitcases and also laid out clothes on the bottom shelf, which meant we had to stoop down each time we needed clothes. Also the water bottle was tall and could tip over easily.

We only stayed at this hotel for 1 evening before we flew out of Mexico City to Cozumel for our honeymoon. Shortly after we booked our room, the hotel sent an email to get to see if they make special accommodations for us. I thought that was so nice, and it was a great way to extend concierge service for their guests. It was perfect because I wanted to do something special for my husband as it was the first night of our honeymoon trip. The representative in the lobby with whom I was exchanging emails nailed it! I had sent a card for him to print for my hubby, I had asked for chocolates and a bottle of wine to be left in the room, and I requested a massage for us after dinner. I had communicated all this via email over a month before our travel and I was so blown away with how they got every detail right! They went above what I asked for and even decorated our room & bed with rose petals. It was such a pleasant surprise for my hubby and it even made him tear up! After we stepped out for dinner, we got back and there were masseuses ready and waiting for us in the lobby. After a long travel, we received the most wonderful massage inside our room, with two complimentary personal servings of Italian rose! Another amazing thing they did for us that I must mention is that we had requested for a taxi to come and get us at the airport, for whatever reason the taxi driver ended up getting there before we even landed and when we landed and looked for our driver, he was nowhere to be found. When we returned from dinner, the taxi driver was waiting in the lobby of the hotel and asked that we pay him even though we didn't use his services. During the time that my husband was having this conversation with the taxi driver, the rep at the front desk stepped in and simply said the hotel will take care of their taxi expense and completely diffused the conversation so that we could return to our room and get ready for our massage.
We loved everything about our stay here! We will stay longer next time we visit, our only complaint is that we couldn't stay here longer.
Hotel staff were amazing, so nice and accommodating. Room was nice, no windows but wasn't an issue. Size was good and location was great for an amazing value! Cute rooftop bar
Historic building refurbished with modern and tasteful style. Very good breakfast and restaurant. Extremely helpful Staff.

The property is beautiful, clean and stylish. The roof top cafe has great food and coffee and fantastic cocktails! The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms were clean and had a great shower. The location was great. We walked to bars and cafes and shops. But the best part of Casa Prim Hotel are the staff! They were so friendly, so accommodating and so helpful. I would go back here anytime I am back in CDMX!
nothing! it was great.

Staff was respectful, courteous and ready to assist in anyway possible.
Hotel has a rooftop restaurant, food was tasty, wait staff went above and beyond. I will definitely stay there again.
What's not to like.
Great location, amazing staff and a lovely rooftop restaurant. The property is in a safe and quiet neighborhood perfect for a couple or solo female travelers.
Wifi in the room didn’t work but was strong other places in the hotel.
Everything about this hotel was top notch. The service was amazing, Roberto really made us feel at home. The rooms were extremely polished and functional. Restaurant food is exceptional.
Building itself and newly furnished and design rooms was great.
everything was great. thanks for the all staff
The location and architecture of the building. You definitely get the Mexican feel to it! Price quality is right up there. We felt like we were at home. The staff were super friendly too.
Rooms are nice and spacious, breakfast is very good on a nice sunny rooftop

Casa Prim is a small, superbe boutique hotel in the central Roma neighbourhood of Mexico City, clean, convenient with big rooms and very attentive staff. highly recommended for a short stay to enjoy the city.

The room had a nice design and was comfortable. We enjoyed our stay very much. Staff was friendly, also breakfast staff was very friendly. Our room was located away from outside noise. Tip: head south from the hotel to enjoy the hip neighbourhood.
The sheets we were given had a stain, but were replaced quickly after asking. Breakfast is very tastefull, however the choices are limited when breakfast is included.
The staff: front desk, security/doormen and housekeeping were all very helpful and efficient, and made me feel comfortable and secure.
I like the hotel very much, but more businesses in the area would’ve been nice. However, you can find many other things to do, with just a short car ride away.
Location is good, venue good. Room comfortable. I was not able to turn the tv.
Did not like the room it was very close to the front desk. Amenities in the room appear to be old, no body wash.
Great boutique hotel in a perfect central location. Staff were all super friendly and helpful. We will definitely consider returning when we revisit this beautiful city.

Hotel is beautiful! Room was spacious and well-decorated, and everything in good working order. The shutters on the balcony doors kept the room dark, and kept street noise to a minimum also. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Restaurant/bar on the rooftop were good, and cafe beside the lobby was quite handy.
No hand soap in the washroom, and bedroom floor was overdue for a cleaning. Both seemed to be an oversight by housekeeping, and are really just nitpicking - neither caused any issue.
Perfect location/ nice big room/ clean/ nespresso with pods, kept safe our luggage on last day,/ safe box in the room.
Shower gel was empty even though we asked for a refill, this never happened.  No view/balcony
The property was amazing!  My partner is an architect/designer and has designed over 300 luxury hotels around the world and she could not say enough great things about this property.
Everything.  from the moment you arrive, you feel a beautiful energy!

Very nice hotel. The staff is kind and welcoming. Modern room, clean and comfortable. 
The location of the hotel is ideal if you want to be close to the main attractions.

Would have been nice to have a refrigerator in the room and the towels could have been softer. 
The stairs are close to the rooms and quite noisy.
